reviews.text:
The Haffenreffer Museum's Collection Research Center in Bristol, RI houses the Museum's offices, research spaces, etc. It is accessible by appointment only. 
Exhibits are free and open to the public in the Museum's Gallery in Providence, RI. The Museum moved its public space to Providence in 2008. Visit the Haffenreffer Museum website for more details.
Nice musem and good prices

This is where all your tax money is dumped. They replace it year around one tiny patch at a time ! They haven't stopped working on this bridge the entire time I lived on the islands ! You could build ten bridges for what this thing is costing tax payers. Someone needs to check the books !
My sister goes to RWU and i find that this is a great college fit for Diversity!
A great way to get from Bristol to Portsmouth. Beats swimming especially in the winter months.
A great old bridge! I was surprised it was free to crossover! Really classy and scenic!
Very cool bridge. I have no problems with it (but, then again, I am from NYC so I KNOW about scary bridges)

Great, fast, and friendly. Everything you could ask for in a perfect pizza and sandwich shop. There pizza is excellent and you must have there mozzarella sticks, they are larger than life. My favorite is there chicken parmigiana sub.

The food came 20 minutes faster than anticipated, which was a bonus. The mozzarella sticks we're great! However, the Florentine pizza was a great big soggy nasty mess. So much so it turned my stomach and couldn't eat it. Which is disappointing, especially considering I ordered an extra large. 😒

Ordered an hour before my break at work. After an hour and a half later I called and was forced to cancel my order. Wasn’t going to pay,  for wilted food. Not to mention...  my lunch break was over and was starving anyhow so why bother. Like , the order was salad 🥗 . How long to make that and deliver 10 minutes down the road . Just saying!!!!
Delicious calzones and large portions for your money.

Ordered a meatball pizza a few Sunday's ago... The crust and cheese was great. The sauce was ehh and meatballs didn't taste like homemade meatballs it even looked weird. 
It looked like someone bought frozen meatballs at Stop & Shop, heated them up on the microwave and broke each meatball into 100 pieces with their fingers and threw it in the oven.
Woke up the next morning with food poisoning that felt like an excruciating painful stomach bug. 
I may try this place one more time but if something like this happens again I'll not come back

I really like this place. It's in a very nice part of Bristol. Easy parking. The first floor has an awesome basement feel to it. The second floor is much brighter and has great water view. The food is good and the service is prompt.

Great place that seamlessly blends the feel of a fancy restaurant and local pub. If I were in town if be a bar regular but be fully comfortable also coming for a nice dinner. Didn't try the food but it looked good.

Have been here many times. Like the old dock warehouse feel. The exposed beams. A must try is the lobster popovers. So good and so rich. The filet minion is so tender. It is a pricey place, but you know that going in. Great place for a romantic meal.
Great chef and fantastic feel to this friendly bar area and restaurant.  Bartenders are friendly and innovative.
LOVE the lobster stuffed popovers.   Lovely atmosphere.  Interesting and varied menu.  Love this place.
On the pricey side but the menu offers a large selection, freshly prepared, clean space and friendly staff.
Really pretty place and very spacious! The food I got was super tasty, and I even had a few bites of my boyfriends dish which was yum as well. Definitely recommend you give it a go!

Visiting RI from PA I have to say this place was ultra impressive in size. Food was pretty good and booths were very comfy. Nice ambiance. Weird name of the place but hey. .the food was out of this world...
Great food. Fresh!  Reasonably priced. Would go back again
Good food nice people fun time

We are frequent diners here. Recently we went for my birthday. Our waitress was fantastic..very attentive to our party of 8. We ordered 4 appertizers & 2 large pizzas plus beverages. Although we didn't order the Hawaiian pizza this time, it's excellent! Their turkey club is very good too.

The Wave is a great family restaurant.  They have a spacious dining room, very clean, and the decor is fun.  The food is delicious and the staff are very nice.  We have had a good experience every time we have visited and wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Wave to others.  
The restaurant is ADA friendly to a degree.  There are no stairs needed to enter the restaurant, though I am not sure if they have a button for automatic doors for either their entrance or bathrooms.  There is a concrete step outside, but it does have a slanted area for those with assistive technology.  The bathrooms are large enough for wheelchair users, as it is a large one-person facility with no stalls.  Again, I don't recall if they have the buttons for assistance with doors.  The dining area is easily accessible for individuals with various needs.

While poor at times, The Wave has their shining moments. When I am hankering for a pizza, I often think of this place. It's good pizza with  decent portions, and it's all around pretty good. Although their entrees can be disappointing, and I find it best to stick to the 'za, they have some polite, kind staff and it's always fun seeing the wacky decor.
Great food. Amazing service. A little hard to find at first but just might be my new #1 spot while up in Bristol.
Always great food specials are awesome too wait staff very helpful

Whenever I want authentic Italian cuisine, I immediately think of Roberto's. The staff is attentive, friendly, and always make you feel like you're one of the family. I always try to order something different and have yet to be disappointed. Absolutely phenomenal dishes and cocktails. 10/10. Would highly recommend.
a little pricey - ~$20 a plate at least for an entree - but worth every penny! excellent quality, plenty vegetarian and gluten-free options
Much better than I even expected.  I thought it would be good but it was excellent.  Everything was cooked well, service was good, really couldn't ask for anything more.

Best Italian food in southern New England, hands down.  My wife I and travel from across the country and always stop in Roberto's in Bristol.  Well worth the drive there from anywhere.  Beats the North End completely.
Had a delicious meal, great atmosphere, excellent cocktails, and yummy dessert.  Highly recommend.

I've enjoyed every meal I've had here. The food is great and the staff is very friendly and welcoming. Not to mention Sunset makes the best dirty chai latte anywhere. Looks a lot smaller from the outside than it actually is, with some solid table space large enough to accommodate bigger parties. All wrapped up in a quaint hometown diner vibe, Sunset is definitely worth a visit.

A cozy little place, but well worth the wait once you get inside. 
Every thing is fresh made there.
If you like your coffee hot.
There special made coffee mugs from a local artist  keep your coffee all threw your breakfast. 
High scale food at a local price.
The Sunset Cafe is one of the best places for breakfast in Rhode Island. The food and service are exceptional. We drive 30 minutes to get here and its always worth the time.

Sunday after Church,  it was very crowded,  yet the service was extremely fast. It has a nice atmosphere and everything was clean. The prices were lower than I expected in the center of town. The food portions were large.  We'll be back.

This place certainly deserves all of their many, many 5 star reviews. My husband and I came here for the first time this morning, knowing full well we'd have to wait for a good amount of time to be seated thanks to the holiday weekend crowds. We were just hoping the wait would be worth it. After a reasonable wait for the food to come to our table, we quickly found that it in fact was worth the wait. Even their simplest dishes are made fresh and from scratch. Everything was cooked and seasoned beautifully and the prices are amazing for what you get. We will happily spend many more mornings at this place.

Side note: this place is adorable but tiny so it is not ideal for groups larger than 5 or 6 people if your hoping to be seated.

Great little seafood restaurant on the water I'm Bristol. Their seafood is very fresh and cooked perfectly. Love going there once every summer. They have indoor and outdoor seating both of which are great. Outside you get to sit right by the water.
Lobster bisque wad great.  Clam chowder and crab cakes mediocre. Shrimp was cooked well.  But definitely did not taste like coconut shrimp.
Love this little local joint.  Good for seafood pasta or friend seafood.  Cannot go wrong

This place is really good. I have never heard of anyone having a bad meal, and I have been here several times.  I guess the only bad thing I could say is that it gets busy and it can be difficult to park, so plan accordingly.
Great food. Great water view

My daughter in-laws brother had his wedding reception there and they had like a buffet set up it was around 15 people she said everything was perfect and bride and groom were satisfied it is not cheap but it is quality food I went over 20 years ago and I never forgot the lamb chop I had if you want a day to remember and great food this is the top. Cafe Central has a nice atmosphere and very good live music. The food is very good as same as the wine. The service is very good and the place is expensive.

This review actually just showed up for the wrong restaurant. This is the correct restaurant. Im sitting. 2 blocks from our southern border. "Best restaurant in town" a fellow flyer told me. Fully expecting Mexican food I was surprised and delighted to enjoy incredibly delicious Italian Food! Valet parking and beautiful decor combined with a very well trained staff provided a fabulous, white table cloth style dining experience. They feature an extensive wine list. My lobster ravioli was so good I thought about it for hours. My friends commented that their meals were incredible as well. Yes,El Paso features some great Mexican restaurants. But, if you love Italian food, this us the place. First class all the way;

Good service. Good food. Average entree priced about $30.
We were seated where cold air would blast us every time door was opened and it was opened frequently. Plenty of seating available. Would have been nice to have been seated out of the cold blast.

This place is amazing!  Now, by no means am I made out of money nor do I make a lot of money.  But the staff here treats everyone with 5 star service.  From the moment you walk in, as they open the door you're welcomed by modern decor and soft lighting setting the mood for a romantic evening.  You are warmly greeted by the front staff and they take your coat.  The tables look lovely with a cream white table cloths, two large wine glasses and silverware methodically laid out for you.  The wait staff was awesome working as a team to provide you the type of service you usually get at fancy restaurants in Beverly Hills, but here in El Paso.  I never had to wait for a drink or a refill.  The food was delicious and it came out promptly.  Yeah, it is a little pricey, but you definitely get more than what you paid for here.  It was worth every dollar and I will definitely be coming back again.
Food is always delicious and the service is great!! The staff is friendly and takes pride in remembering their customers. Love this place for lunch, dinner and special occasions.
Food was great. There was a small wait to be seated but the food was fantastic. The coffee was so so.
I just visited the beehive Cafe. They have exceptional desserts and  coffee. The service is wonderful. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for desserts, coffee and other prepared foods.

Nice spot. Happy it was open on Monday. Must've come in as the staff needed a break 'cause they were much nicer to other who came in after we were served. So, one less  star for begrudging service.

I tried the golden latte...spicy good. My mom had a perfectly pumpkin latte. Flavor was on point, but the latte was sloshed during the pour, so the cup was swimming on delivery. That sloppiness doesn't behoove a nice spot like this. Sticky sipping really detracts from the special visit. A quick wipe and new saucer would've made a much nicer experience.

A bit more attention to detail could make this place 100%

I first started going here in 2012. I LOVE the daily specials, the dietary variety (gf, vegetarian, vegan), and the variety of drinks that are available. The prices are fair, and each plate comes out looking picture worthy. There are upstairs, deck, and outside seating. If you're looking for a cute, unique spot for a quick cup of coffee or to meet up with a friend for lunch, this is a great spot.

The Beehive Cafe is an adorable neighborhood gem in Bristol, RI. It’s the perfect way to end a ride along the East Bay Bikepath. I’ve gone two times and you can definitely expect a wait on the weekends, but it’s worth it. You’ll have to wait in line to order at the counter, but hopefully you’ve brought along a friend who can snag a table somewhere for you. The polenta cakes with poached eggs and pesto are divine. Exactly the kind of thing you want to refuel you for the ride back home. The crispy chickpeas are *addictive.* Oh my goodness. You’ll be craving them for days!
